Nom: Sam and Friends - The Story of Jim Henson's First Television Show (hardback)
Description:
Long before Sesame Street and The Muppet Show, college students Jim Henson and Jane Nebel created a long-running daily local Washington, D.C. television program called Sam and Friends, where Jim developed his unique approach to comedy and introduced the world to a puppet named Kermit.

In this book, President of The Jim Henson Legacy and author of The Muppets Character Encyclopedia, Craig Shemin, explores the story behind Sam and Friends and creates an episode guide from surviving scripts and recordings.

Includes a foreword by longtime Henson collaborator Frank Oz, several complete scripts and more than 150 rare photos from The Jim Henson Company Archives.

Derri√®re le sourire enthousiaste de Sylvain Augier, tant aim√© de millions de fran√ßais, animateur de La Carte aux tr√©sors, Faut pas r√™ver et La France vue du ciel, il y avait un secret bien cach√© : la bipolarit√©. Cette maladie psychique qui entra√Æne exaltation et d√©pression parfois jusqu'au suicide.
Dans son r√©cit s'entrem√™lent succ√®s et d√©sespoir. La famille y apparait porteuse de joies et de souffrances. C'est un formidable message d'espoir : on peut revenir de loin.

Pr√©face de Boris Cyrulnik.

Nom: Friends, mes amours et cette chose terrible

Nom: Miss May Does Not Exist: The Life and Work of Elaine May, Hollywood‚Äôs Hidden Genius
Description:
Miss May Does Not Exist, by Carrie Courogen is the riveting biography of comedian, director, actor and writer Elaine May, one of America's greatest comic geniuses. May began her career as one-half of the legendary comedy team known as Nichols and May, the duo that revolutionized the comedy sketch.

After performing their Broadway smash An Evening with Mike Nichols and Elaine May, Elaine set out on her own. She toiled unsuccessfully on Broadway for a while, but then headed to Hollywood where she became the director of A New Leaf, The Heartbreak Kid, Mikey and Nicky, and the legendary Ishtar. She was hired as a script doctor on countless films like Heaven Can Wait, Reds, Tootsie, and The Birdcage. In 2019, she returned to Broadway where she won the Tony Award for Best Leading Actress in The Waverly Gallery. Besides her considerable talent, May is well known for her reclusiveness. On one of the albums she made with Mike Nichols, her bio is this: "Miss May does not exist." Until now.

Nom: L'Otium du peuple - A la reconqu√™te du temps libre
Description:
Jug√© indispensable par les Grecs, puis par les Romains, remis en avant par Michel Foucault et la notion de " souci de soi ", l'otium, ce temps n√©cessaire √† la r√©flexion sur le monde et sur soi si n√©cessaire en ces p√©riodes de grande confusion, para√Æt plus actuel que jamais.

Aujourd'hui, tout s'acc√©l√®re et nous agrippe dans un rythme devenu fou. Le temps de la r√©flexion est le grand sacrifi√© de ce nouveau chaos. Jug√© avec les crit√®res de la productivit√©, il passe pour un luxe inutile. Nous le vaporisons donc all√®grement dans les interminables s√©ances de scrolling qui vampirisent nos loisirs. Addicts au shoot √©motionnel des √©crans, nous d√©pensons d√©sormais sans compter notre temps de cerveau disponible.
Comment nous d√©sintoxiquer de ce nouvel opium ? Comment refaire du temps libre un havre o√π, √† nouveau, r√©fl√©chir, imaginer, contempler, comprendre ? D√©cisives pour notre autonomie, ces facult√©s ne doivent plus √™tre la part superflue de l'existence. Loin d'√™tre r√©duit, comme souvent, √† l'oisivet√©, le loisir pourrait ainsi se refonder sur l'otium ‚Äì le " loisir f√©cond " que la pens√©e antique hissait au sommet des activit√©s humaines. Prodigieux espace d'invention existentielle, ce temps lib√©r√© des urgences et des calculs, permettait √† ses b√©n√©ficiaires la qu√™te du for int√©rieur, de la sagesse, du bien commun.
Le moment semble venu de nous r√©approprier cet usage √©mancipateur et responsable du temps libre. R√©v√©lant sa profonde actualit√©, Bourdieu consid√©rait le loisir f√©cond comme une possibilit√© anthropologique universelle et, Foucault, comme l'outil d'un souci de soi soucieux d'autrui. Longtemps r√©serv√© √† quelques-uns, l'otium pourrait bien √™tre le mot capable de traduire ce d√©sir √©perdu de dur√©e et de profondeur qui saisit parfois nos errances digitales. Apr√®s des si√®cles d'oubli, il pourrait enfin devenir l'otium de tous, l'otium du peuple.

Nom: Entrances and Exits
Description:
The man who brought the kavorka to the Seinfeld show through one of the most remarkable and beloved television characters ever invented, Kramer, shares the extraordinary life of a comedy genius‚Äîthe way he came into himself as an artist, the ups and downs as a human being, the road he has traveled in search of understanding.

‚ÄúThe hair, so essential, symbolizes the irrational that was and is and always will be the underlying feature not only of Kramer but of comedy itself. This seemingly senseless spirit has been coursing through me since childhood. I‚Äôve been under its almighty influence since the day I came into this world. I felt it all within myself, especially the physical comedy, the body movements, so freakish and undignified, where I bumped into things, knocked stuff down, messed up situations, and often ended up on my ass.

‚ÄúThis book is a hymn to the irrational, the senseless spirit that breaks the whole into pieces, a reflection on the seemingly absurd difficulties that intrude upon us all. It‚Äôs Harpo Marx turning us about, shaking up my plans, throwing me for a loop. Upset and turmoil is with us all the time. It‚Äôs at the basis of comedy. It‚Äôs the pratfall we all take. It‚Äôs the unavoidable mistake we didn‚Äôt expect. It‚Äôs everywhere I go. It‚Äôs in the way that I am, both light and dark, good and not-so-good. It‚Äôs my life.‚Äù

‚ÄîMichael Richards, from

Nom: Directing Actors: Creating Memorable Performances for Film and Television
Description: Judith says, "In the years since the original edition of Directing Actors was published, the technical side of filmmaking has become much more easily accessible. Directors tell me that dealing with actors is the last frontier the scariest part and the part they long for the human part, the place where connection happens." Weston's books help directors scale the heights of the actor-director dynamic, learn the joys of collaborating with actors and become an "actor's director."

Nom: You Never Know: A Memoir
Description:
There are many miles from the business school and basketball court at the University of Southern California to 50 million viewers for the final episode of a TV show called Magnum P.I. Tom Selleck has lived every one of those miles in his own iconoclastic and joyful way.
Frank, funny and open-hearted, You Never Know is an intimate memoir from a beloved actor, the story of a remarkable life and thoroughly accidental career. Journey to the top in Hollywood, learn of his mistakes and his well-earned success. Selleck clears up an armload of misconceptions and shares never-told stories. His rambunctious California childhood. His clueless arrival as a good-looking college jock in Hollywood (from the Dating Game to the Fox New Talent Program to co-starring with Mae West). What it was like to emerge as a mega-star in his mid-thirties and remain so for decades to come, an actor whose ease on screen connected with audiences worldwide, while redefining the clich√©s of manhood.
